name: NPR
text:
For the first time ever, the NFL has assembled an all-Black officiating crew, led by Jerome Boger, a 17-year NFL official.

The crew will officiate the Monday Night Football game between Tampa Bay Buccaneers and Los Angeles Rams. https://t.co/VYrJ4fdIMm

name: NPR
text: The Egyptian government is facing an international backlash over the arrests of members of a leading Egyptian human rights organization following a meeting with European diplomats Nov. 3. https://t.co/rHumGWAL1T

name: NPR
text:
Britain's Supreme Court is considering whether a 21-year-old who left to join ISIS at age 15 should be permitted to return to the country to argue that her U.K. citizenship shouldn't have been revoked.
https://t.co/4RdrKkE9TF

name: NPR
text: "To be clear, I did not receive any direction to delay my determination," Emily Murphy, the Trump appointee who heads the General Services Administration, wrote in a letter to President-elect Biden. https://t.co/J5kdUGeGpz

name: NPR
text:
Have you heard of Bose-Einstein condensate? Or superfluids?

This week, #NPRShortWave breaks down the *other* states of matter — beyond solid, liquid, gas and plasma.
https://t.co/YofhCf8mhf

name: NPR
text: The usual Thanksgiving spreads may be too big for this year's holiday. Instead, Chefs Anita Lo, Aarón Sánchez and Sohla El-Waylly share recipes for a relatively unfussy but still delicious meal. https://t.co/B4bQOTLPjA

name: NPR
text:
President-elect Biden has pledged to rejoin the pact after Trump withdrew from it. 

But John Kerry — whom Biden has selected to be special presidential envoy for climate — could face skepticism as he seeks to gain the trust of other countries. https://t.co/NXoYKzYWTU

name: NPR
text: RT @HiddenBrain: Big thanks to the team at @1a for inviting Shankar to discuss the psychological dimensions of life during the pandemic. You can hear Shankar's conversation with host Jenn White here: https://t.co/1QrsuCE1pY

name: NPR
text:
Supporters of President-elect Biden in the swing county of Erie, Pa., say they're excited about a return to "a traditional presidency" — and hope Biden will work toward unifying the nation.
https://t.co/rA6no0WVlY

name: NPR
text:
RT @MalakaGharib: it's thanksgiving week and i want to share one of my favorite stories i've written -- POC thanksgiving. i spoke to filipino, rwandan, egyptian, korean and mexican americans and asked them what this holiday was like in their households growing up
https://t.co/7kXe78vVGH

name: NPR
text: President-elect Biden's team should now have access to government office space, will be able to meet with Trump administration officials to discuss policy issues, and will receive some $7.3 million to pay staffers and other expenses. https://t.co/DzrdimbpmI

name: NPR
text:
President-elect Biden announced his intent to nominate Alejandro Mayorkas to head the Department of Homeland Security.

If confirmed, Mayorkas — a Cuban American — would be the first Latino and first immigrant to hold that job. https://t.co/oU2XsqNdqu

name: NPR
text:
The Transportation Security Administration reported that more than 1 million people went through security checkpoints Sunday, the most since mid-March.

The CDC has urged people not to travel for Thanksgiving amid recent outbreaks of coronavirus cases. https://t.co/C47KBl5xor

name: NPR
text:
Children usually do not have severe symptoms of COVID-19 and many have no symptoms, according to the CDC.

A pediatrician in Lexington, Ky., says she has seen that play out in her office, but the older children are, the worse symptoms she has seen. https://t.co/d1BYIYLMr6

name: NPR
text: David Dinkins, New York City's only Black mayor, died Monday night. He broke barriers with his 1989 election -- defeating incumbent Ed Koch in the Democratic primary and later bested Republican Rudolph Giuliani in the general election. https://t.co/MUVImistI5

name: NPR
text:
Sylvan Esso has created Shaking Out The Numb — a podcast with Vermont Public Radio producer Erica Heilman, centered on the creation of the band's latest album, "Free Love."
https://t.co/l4sHji6xLn

name: NPR
text:
Watch R&B veteran KEM perform three songs from his latest album, "Love Always Wins," for our Tiny Desk quarantine series 
https://t.co/lzc6t7jmv7
